question: Which of the following was the real intention of the British to include the princely states in the Federal Union proposed by the India Act of 1935?
option1: exercise more and direct political and administrative control over the princely states
option2: involve the princes actively in the administration of the colony
option3: finally effect the complete political and administrative take-over of all the princely states by the British
option4: use the princes to counter-balance the anti-imperialist doctrines of the nationalist leaders
answer: use the princes to counter-balance the anti-imperialist doctrines of the nationalist leaders
explanation: The real intention of the British to include the princely states in the Federal Union proposed by the India Act of 1935 was to use the princes to counter-balance the antiimperialist doctrines of the nationalist leaders.
